title: Introduction to Data Science Specialization
description: Launch your career in data science. Gain foundational data science skills to prepare for a career or further advanced learning in data science.
prerequisites: Basic computer literacy, familiarity with mathematical concepts, and a strong interest in data analysis.
learning_outcomes: Gain foundational data science skills, including data analysis, machine learning, and programming, to prepare for a data science career or further study.
price: Coursera offers a subscription model. Check the Coursera website for current pricing details.

title: Key Technologies for Business Specialization
description: Get Ahead with Key Business Technologies. Gain Foundational Understanding of Key Technologies Driving Modern Businesses
prerequisites: Basic computer literacy and a general interest in business and technology.
learning_outcomes: Gain foundational understanding of key technologies driving modern businesses, including data science, AI, cloud computing and related concepts.
price: Coursera subscriptions vary; check the Coursera website for current pricing.

title: Deep Learning Specialization
description: Become a Machine Learning expert. Master the fundamentals of deep learning and break into AI. Recently updated with cutting-edge techniques!
prerequisites: Basic Python programming, linear algebra, calculus, and a foundational understanding of machine learning concepts.
learning_outcomes: Master deep learning fundamentals, including neural networks, convolutional networks, recurrent networks, and transformers. Implement deep learning algorithms and build AI applications using TensorFlow.
price: Coursera subscription required.

title: IBM & Darden Digital Strategy Specialization
description: Get ahead with key business and technical skills. Understand how current technologies are changing industry and create strategy to transform your business
prerequisites: Basic understanding of business concepts and familiarity with technology trends are recommended.
learning_outcomes: Understand how technologies reshape industries, create effective digital transformation strategies, and gain key business and technical skills for digital success.
price: Coursera offers a subscription-based model. Prices vary, check Coursera for current costs.

title: IBM AI Foundations for Business Specialization
description: The IBM AI Foundations for Business Specialization provides a comprehensive understanding of AI concepts and their application in business contexts. Learners will explore machine learning, deep learning, and data analytics, gaining skills to leverage AI for strategic decision-making and innovation.
prerequisites: Basic computer literacy, familiarity with spreadsheets, and a general interest in business and technology are recommended.
learning_outcomes: Understand AI concepts, apply machine learning techniques, leverage data analytics for business decisions, and gain skills to implement AI solutions within organizations. It helps to know the usage of the skills like data science and machine learning.
price: Coursera offers a free trial, after which a subscription is required to access course materials and earn a certificate.

title: AI Foundations for Everyone Specialization
description: The AI Foundations for Everyone Specialization provides a broad understanding of artificial intelligence (AI) concepts, technologies, and applications. It covers fundamental AI principles, machine learning basics, deep learning concepts, and how AI is being used across various industries. You will learn how to use Watson and APIs. It is designed for individuals with little to no prior AI experience.
prerequisites: No prior experience in AI or programming is required. Basic computer literacy and a willingness to learn are recommended.
learning_outcomes: Understand core AI concepts like machine learning and deep learning. Explore AI applications across industries, and use Watson. Learn how to use APIs, and gain insights into how AI can be implemented.
price: Coursera offers various subscription options. Please refer to the Coursera website for current pricing.

title: AI for Medicine Specialization
description: The AI for Medicine Specialization on Coursera aims to equip learners with the knowledge and skills to apply artificial intelligence techniques to solve real-world problems in the medical field. The specialization covers a range of topics, including machine learning, deep learning, image segmentation, and natural language processing, with a focus on applications such as medical diagnosis, treatment planning, and drug discovery. Students will learn how to build and evaluate AI models for various medical tasks, interpret their results, and understand the ethical considerations involved in using AI in healthcare. The program uses examples such as Image Segmentation, Machine Learning, time-to-event modeling, Deep Learning, Random Forest, Multi-class classification, model tuning, and treatment effect estimation. The specialization is designed for individuals with a background in computer science, mathematics, or a related field who are interested in pursuing a career in AI for medicine.
prerequisites: Basic knowledge of Python programming, linear algebra, calculus, and probability. Familiarity with machine learning concepts is recommended.
learning_outcomes: Apply AI techniques to medical diagnosis, treatment planning, and drug discovery. Build and evaluate AI models for medical tasks and interpret results, understanding the ethical considerations of AI in healthcare.
price: Coursera subscription required (prices vary).

title: Advanced Data Science with IBM Specialization
description: Expert in Data Science, Machine Learning and AI. Become an IBM-approved Expert in Data Science, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.
prerequisites: Basic Python programming, introductory statistics, and familiarity with machine learning concepts are recommended.
learning_outcomes: Become an IBM-approved expert in Data Science, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence. Master advanced techniques for practical applications.
price: Coursera subscription required

title: Machine Learning Specialization
description: Build Intelligent Applications. Master machine learning fundamentals in four hands-on courses.
prerequisites: Basic Python programming, linear algebra, calculus, and probability.
learning_outcomes: Master machine learning fundamentals and build intelligent applications through hands-on projects, covering concepts such as regression, classification, and deep learning.
price: Coursera subscription required (price varies by location and subscription type).

title: TensorFlow 2 for Deep Learning Specialization
description: This Specialization provides a comprehensive introduction to deep learning using TensorFlow 2. You'll learn to build and train neural networks, master TensorFlow tools, and develop skills in areas like computer vision, natural language processing, and generative models. The specialization covers TensorFlow, Keras, TensorFlow Probability, and probabilistic neural networks.
prerequisites: Basic Python programming, foundational understanding of machine learning concepts like linear regression and gradient descent.
learning_outcomes: Build and train deep learning models using TensorFlow 2; implement computer vision, NLP, and generative models; utilize TensorFlow tools for probabilistic neural networks and understand Keras.
price: Coursera offers a subscription-based model. Check Coursera for current pricing details for this Specialization.

title: Deep Learning for Healthcare Specialization
description: Neural Networks in Applied Medicine. Learn the latest cutting-edge methods in Deep Learning for Medical Applications
prerequisites: Basic Python programming, understanding of linear algebra and calculus, familiarity with machine learning concepts.
learning_outcomes: Learn cutting-edge deep learning methods for medical applications. Understand neural networks in applied medicine, including techniques for big data and healthcare graphs.
price: Paid

title: IBM Data Science Professional Certificate
description: Kickstart your career in data science & ML. Build data science skills, learn Python & SQL, analyze & visualize data, build machine learning models. No degree or prior experience required.
prerequisites: No prior experience required, but basic computer literacy is helpful.
learning_outcomes: Gain data science skills, including Python & SQL programming, data analysis & visualization, and building machine learning models. Learn to apply data science methodologies.
price: Coursera subscription required. Prices vary by location and subscription plan.

title: IBM Applied AI Professional Certificate
description: Kickstart your career in artificial intelligence. Learn Python, build a chatbot, explore machine learning and computer vision, and leverage IBM Watson.
prerequisites: Basic computer literacy and familiarity with fundamental programming concepts are recommended.
learning_outcomes: Upon completion, learners will be able to use Python for AI, build chatbots, apply machine learning and computer vision techniques, and leverage IBM Watson services.
price: Coursera subscription required

title: IBM AI Engineering Professional Certificate
description: Launch your career as an AI engineer. Learn how to provide business insights from big data using machine learning and deep learning techniques.
prerequisites: Basic Python programming
High school level mathematics (linear algebra and calculus)
Familiarity with data analysis concepts
learning_outcomes: Gain skills to derive business insights from big data using machine learning and deep learning techniques. Master tools like Keras, OpenCV, and SciPy for AI engineering applications.
price: Coursera subscription required

title: IBM Machine Learning Professional Certificate
description: Machine Learning, Time Series & Survival Analysis. Develop working skills in the main areas of Machine Learning: Supervised Learning, Unsupervised Learning, Deep Learning, and Reinforcement Learning. Also gain practice in specialized topics such as Time Series Analysis and Survival Analysis.

title: AI Fundamentals for Non-Data Scientists
description: In this course, you will go in-depth to discover how Machine Learning is used to handle and interpret Big Data. You will get a detailed look at the various ways and methods to create algorithms to incorporate into your business with such tools as Teachable Machine and TensorFlow. You will also learn different ML methods, Deep Learning, as well as the limitations but also how to drive accuracy and use the best training data for your algorithms. You will then explore GANs and VAEs, using your newfound knowledge to engage with AutoML to help you start building algorithms that work to suit your needs. You will also see exclusive interviews with industry leaders, who manage Big Data for companies such as McDonald's and Visa. By the end of this course, you will have learned different ways to code, including how to use no-code tools, understand Deep Learning, how to measure and review errors in your algorithms, and how to use Big Data to not only maintain customer privacy but also how to use this data to develop different strategies that will drive your business.

title: AI Applications in Marketing and Finance
description: In this course, you will learn about AI-powered applications that can enhance the customer journey and extend the customer lifecycle. You will learn how this AI-powered data can enable you to analyze consumer habits and maximize their potential to target your marketing to the right people. You will also learn about fraud, credit risks, and how AI applications can also help you combat the ever-challenging landscape of protecting consumer data. You will also learn methods to utilize supervised and unsupervised machine learning to enhance your fraud detection methods. You will also hear from leading industry experts in the world of data analytics, marketing, and fraud prevention. By the end of this course, you will have a substantial understanding of the role AI and Machine Learning play when it comes to consumer habits, and how we are able to interact and analyze information to increase deep learning potential for your business.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of marketing and finance principles.
Familiarity with data analytics concepts is helpful.
learning_outcomes: Understand AI's role in consumer behavior, analyze data to improve deep learning for business, and apply supervised/unsupervised learning for enhanced fraud detection. Learn from industry experts.
price: Coursera Subscription Required

title: Deep Neural Networks with PyTorch
description: The course will teach you how to develop deep learning models using  Pytorch. The course will start with Pytorch's  tensors and Automatic differentiation package. Then each section will cover different models starting off with fundamentals such as Linear Regression, and logistic/softmax regression. Followed by  Feedforward deep neural networks, the role of different activation functions, normalization and dropout layers. Then Convolutional Neural Networks and Transfer learning will be covered. Finally, several other Deep learning methods will be covered.

title: Neural Networks and Deep Learning
description: In the first course of the Deep Learning Specialization, you will study the foundational concept of neural networks and deep learning.
prerequisites: Basic Python programming, familiarity with linear algebra and calculus concepts.
learning_outcomes: Understand the core concepts of neural networks and deep learning. Learn about neural network architectures, backpropagation, and how to implement them.
price: Coursera offers a free audit option or a paid certificate option.

title: What is Data Science?
description: Do you want to know why Data Science has been labelled as the sexiest profession of the 21st century? After taking this course you will be able to answer this question, and get a thorough understanding of what is Data Science, what data scientists do, and learn about career paths in the field.

title: Improving Deep Neural Networks: Hyperparameter Tuning, Regularization and Optimization
description: In the second course of the Deep Learning Specialization, you will open the deep learning black box to understand the processes that drive performance and generate good results systematically.

title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence (AI)
description: In this course you will learn what Artificial Intelligence (AI) is, explore use cases and applications of AI, understand AI concepts and terms like machine learning, deep learning and neural networks. You will be exposed to various issues and concerns surrounding AI such as ethics and bias, & jobs, and get advice from experts about learning and starting a career in AI.  You will also demonstrate AI in action with a mini project.

title: Introduction to TensorFlow for Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning
description: If you are a software developer who wants to build scalable AI-powered algorithms, you need to understand how to use the tools to build them. This course is part of the upcoming Machine Learning in Tensorflow Specialization and will teach you best practices for using TensorFlow, a popular open-source framework for machine learning.

title: Convolutional Neural Networks
description: In the fourth course of the Deep Learning Specialization, you will understand how computer vision has evolved and become familiar with its exciting applications such as autonomous driving, face recognition, reading radiology images, and more.

title: Structuring Machine Learning Projects
description: In the third course of the Deep Learning Specialization, you will learn how to build a successful machine learning project and get to practice decision-making as a machine learning project leader.

title: Machine Learning with Python
description: Get ready to dive into the world of Machine Learning (ML) by using Python! This course is for you whether you want to advance your Data Science career or get started in Machine Learning and Deep Learning.

title: Sequence Models
description: In the fifth course of the Deep Learning Specialization, you will become familiar with sequence models and their exciting applications such as speech recognition, music synthesis, chatbots, machine translation, natural language processing (NLP), and more.

title: Machine Learning Foundations for Product Managers
description: In this first course of the AI Product Management Specialization offered by Duke University's Pratt School of Engineering, you will build a foundational understanding of what machine learning is, how it works and when and why it is applied.  To successfully manage an AI team or product and work collaboratively with data scientists, software engineers, and customers you need to understand the basics of machine learning technology.  This course provides a non-coding introduction to machine learning, with focus on the process of developing models, ML model evaluation and interpretation, and the intuition behind common ML and deep learning algorithms.  The course will conclude with a hands-on project in which you will have a chance to train and optimize a machine learning model on a simple real-world problem.

title: AI for Medical Diagnosis
description: AI is transforming the practice of medicine. It’s helping doctors diagnose patients more accurately, make predictions about patients’ future health, and recommend better treatments. As an AI practitioner, you have the opportunity to join in this transformation of modern medicine. If you're already familiar with some of the math and coding behind AI algorithms, and are eager to develop your skills further to tackle challenges in the healthcare industry, then this specialization is for you. No prior medical expertise is required!

title: Getting Started with AI using IBM Watson
description: In this course you will learn how to quickly and easily get started with Artificial Intelligence using IBM Watson. You will understand how Watson works, become familiar with its use cases and real life client examples, and be introduced to several of Watson AI services from IBM that enable anyone to easily apply AI and build smart apps. You will also work with several Watson services to demonstrate AI in action.

title: Machine Learning Introduction for Everyone
description: This three-module course introduces machine learning and data science for everyone with a foundational understanding of machine learning models. You’ll learn about the history of machine learning, applications of machine learning, the machine learning model lifecycle, and tools for machine learning. You’ll also learn about supervised versus unsupervised learning, classification, regression, evaluating machine learning models, and more. Our labs give you hands-on experience with these machine learning and data science concepts. You will develop concrete machine learning skills as well as create a final project demonstrating your proficiency.

title: Introduction to Deep Learning & Neural Networks with Keras
description: Looking to start a career in Deep Learning? Look no further. This course will introduce you to the field of deep learning and help you answer many questions that people are asking nowadays, like what is deep learning, and how do deep learning models compare to artificial neural networks? You will learn about the different deep learning models and build your first deep learning model using the Keras library.

title: Introduction to Computer Vision and Image Processing
description: Computer Vision is one of the most exciting fields in Machine Learning and AI. It has applications in many industries, such as self-driving cars, robotics, augmented reality, and much more. In this beginner-friendly course, you will understand computer vision and learn about its various applications across many industries.

title: Convolutional Neural Networks
description: In the fourth course of the Deep Learning Specialization, you will understand how computer vision has evolved and become familiar with its exciting applications such as autonomous driving, face recognition, reading radiology images, and more.

title: Applied AI with DeepLearning

description: In the second course of the Deep Learning Specialization, you will open the deep learning black box to understand the processes that drive performance and generate good results systematically.

description: This course covers deep learning (DL) methods, healthcare data and applications using DL methods. The courses include activities such as video lectures, self guided programming labs, homework assignments (both written and programming), and a large project.

Knowledge of Machine Learning
Understanding of Deep Learning concepts
Experience with neural networks

title: What is Data Science?
description: Do you want to know why Data Science has been labelled as the sexiest profession of the 21st century? After taking this course you will be able to answer this question, and get a thorough understanding of what is Data Science, what data scientists do, and learn about career paths in the field.
prerequisites: No prior experience required. Basic computer literacy is helpful.
learning_outcomes: Understand the definition of Data Science, the role of a Data Scientist, and explore various career paths within the field. Gain insight into why Data Science is a sought-after profession.

learning_outcomes: Understand AI concepts, applications, and terminology (machine learning, deep learning). Explore ethical concerns and career paths in AI. Demonstrate AI in action through a mini-project.

title: AI for Medical Prognosis
description: AI is transforming the practice of medicine. It’s helping doctors diagnose patients more accurately, make predictions about patients’ future health, and recommend better treatments. This Specialization will give you practical experience in applying machine learning to concrete problems in medicine.
prerequisites: Basic Python programming, introductory machine learning concepts, and familiarity with statistical analysis.
learning_outcomes: Apply machine learning to medical problems, predict patient health outcomes, and recommend treatments using AI. Gain practical experience in medical AI applications.

To successfully manage an AI team or product and work collaboratively with data scientists, software engineers, and customers you need to understand the basics of machine learning technology.  This course provides a non-coding introduction to machine learning, with focus on the process of developing models, ML model evaluation and interpretation, and the intuition behind common ML and deep learning algorithms. Familiarity with business concepts

description: In this course you will learn how to quickly and easily get started with Artificial Intelligence using IBM Watson. You will understand how Watson works, become familiar with its use cases and real life client examples, and be introduced to several of Watson AI services from IBM that enable anyone to easily apply AI and build smart apps. You will also work with several Watson services to demonstrate AI in action.
prerequisites: Basic computer literacy and familiarity with using web applications. No prior programming or AI knowledge is required.
learning_outcomes: Understand how IBM Watson works and its real-world applications. Learn to apply AI using various Watson services and build smart applications. Work hands-on with Watson to see AI in action.
price: Free to audit. Paid certificate available.

title: Technologies and platforms for Artificial Intelligence
description: This course will address the hardware technologies for machine and deep learning (from the units of an Internet-of-Things system to a large-scale data centers) and will explore the families of machine and deep learning platforms (libraries and frameworks) for the design and development of smart applications and systems.
prerequisites: Basic programming knowledge
Familiarity with linear algebra
Understanding of fundamental machine learning concepts
learning_outcomes: Understand hardware technologies for machine learning, from IoT devices to data centers. Explore machine and deep learning platforms for designing intelligent applications and systems.
price: Paid

description: In this course, you will learn about AI-powered applications that can enhance the customer journey and extend the customer lifecycle. You will learn how this AI-powered data can enable you to analyze consumer habits and maximize their potential to target your marketing to the right people. You will also learn about fraud, credit risks, and how AI applications can also help you combat the ever-challenging landscape of protecting consumer data. You will also learn methods to utilize supervised and unsupervised machine learning to enhance your fraud detection methods. learning_outcomes: Understand AI applications in marketing and finance. Analyze consumer habits, target marketing effectively, and combat fraud. Utilize supervised and unsupervised machine learning for enhanced fraud detection, ultimately increasing deep learning potential for business.

title: Health Data Science Foundation
description: This course is intended for persons involved in machine learning who are interested in medical applications, or vice versa, medical professionals who are interested in the methods modern computer science has to offer to their field. We will cover health data analysis, different types of neural networks, as well as training and application of neural networks applied on real-world medical scenarios.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and programming (e.g., Python). Familiarity with medical terminology is helpful but not required.
learning_outcomes: Learn health data analysis techniques, understand various neural network types, and apply neural networks to real-world medical scenarios for practical problem-solving.
price: Paid

After taking this course you will be able to answer this question, and get a thorough understanding of what is Data Science, what data scientists do, and learn about career paths in the field.
